This property verifies that the ResetByteCnt signal is correctly assigned when the TxReset signal becomes active. 

Specifically, on every rising edge of the MTxClk clock, unless the TxReset signal is low (which acts as a disable condition), the following must hold: when TxReset is high, ResetByteCnt must equal the logical OR of TxReset itself with the condition where TxCtrlStartFrm is low and either TxDoneIn or TxAbortIn is high.

In other words, whenever TxReset is asserted, ResetByteCnt must be set to 1 if either TxReset is high, or if TxCtrlStartFrm is not active and either TxDoneIn or TxAbortIn is active.
